sentence: [You don't quite remember how you arrived in this forest, but it is a serene place. Motes of light drift lazily throught the trees. Everything is paceful.]

author: unknow
sentence: Hello, stranger

author: mysterious fox
sentence: I haven't seen you before. Or mybe I have! Hard to say.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Tell me, why do you wander?

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Are you lost, prehaps? Go ahead, speak. There's no shame in being honest.
responses: I'm a little turned around, that's all.
I'm extremely attractive and never get lost. And I smell good.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: How interesting! You're not spirit... or are you? Your scent is different somehow. And the way you talk...

author: mysterious fox
sentence: How did you get there, stranger?
responses: You're not secretly a beutiful fox person, are you?

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Many spirits walk these woods, searching for old friends and lost loves.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: But the day is long, and the sun is warm, and soon they all forget. That is the nature of place.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Oh, don't worry. None of them mind. They're much happier now.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Otherwise they'd all be demons. Hee hee.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Who can say? Few spirits come looking for these, but many find them.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Here the days are long, and the sun is warm, and in time all within forget themselves. It is not unpleasant, but it is not your fate.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Or mybe it is! You're quite fascinating, stranger.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: I'm not sure what you are... besides lost, of course.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: My, how flattering! Sad to say, but I am simply fox. A very mysterious one.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: But a beautiful fox person? I wonder who could you mean. Certainly no one in these woods.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Everyone here is spirit. And the longer they stay here, the more about themselves they forget. It's quite peaceful... so I'm told.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: You're not a spirit though, are you? Or prehaps you are. How exciting.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: Hmm. Why don't you follow me, stranger? I'll lead you to safety.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: ... Or you can stay here forever. It's up to you! But don't take long to deciding.

author: mysterious fox
sentence: You might just start to forget yourself. Hee hee.
[The fox runs off ahead, waiting at the edge of the forest path.]
[It beckons you to follow.]
